item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bayleaf · Building a low-profile wireless split keyboard (291 points | 93 comments)
2. Learn How to Break AES (49 points | 2 comments)
3. Satellogic's Open Satellite Feed (93 points | 5 comments)
4. Translating Natural Language to First-Order Logic for Logical Fallacy Detection (27 points | 6 comments)
5. Launch HN: Enhanced Radar (YC W25) – A safety net for air traffic control (25 points | 13 comments)
6. DARPA exploring growing bio structures of "unprecedented size" in microgravity (17 points | 4 comments)
7. Farallon Islands live (and controllable) webcam (16 points | 11 comments)
8. Show HN: Appstat – Process Monitor for Windows (40 points | 5 comments)
9. Foundry (YC F24) Hiring Founding Engineer to Build an Internet-Scale Web Crawler ( | hide)
10. Who's Afraid of Tom Wolfe? (6 points | discuss)
11. The owner of ip4.me/ip6.me, Kevin Loch, passed away (214 points | 54 comments)
12. Repairable Flatpack Toaster (722 points | 227 comments)
13. Show HN: Vidformer – Drop-In Acceleration for Cv2 Video Annotation Scripts (8 points | 1 comment)
14. Windows NT for GameCube/Wii (187 points | 55 comments)
15. Enhancing Frame Detection with Retrieval Augmented Generation (27 points | 5 comments)
16. Show HN: Fork of Claude-code working with local and other LLM providers (25 points | 7 comments)
17. Notorious Malware, Spam Host "Prospero" Moves to Kaspersky Lab (13 points | 3 comments)
18. Lawrence of Arabia, Paul Atreides, and the roots of Frank Herbert's Dune (2021) (236 points | 133 comments)
19. TSMC expected to announce $100B investment in U.S. (378 points | 760 comments)
20. DIY "infinity contrast" TV – with 100% recycled parts [video] (55 points | 21 comments)
21. Show HN: PG-Capture – a better way to sync Postgres with Algolia (or Elastic) (16 points | 2 comments)
22. DeepSeek's smallpond: Bringing Distributed Computing to DuckDB (153 points | 12 comments)
23. The IBM 650: An appreciation from the field (1986) [pdf] (35 points | 14 comments)
24. SQLite-on-the-server is misunderstood: Better at hyper-scale than micro-scale (304 points | 141 comments)
25. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (March 2025) (354 points | 331 comments)
26. Should Managers Still Code? (48 points | 48 comments)
27. An Experimental Study of Bitmap Compression vs. Inverted List Compression (21 points | 5 comments)
28. Hacking the Xbox 360 Hypervisor Part 2: The Bad Update Exploit (246 points | 95 comments)
29. Ask HN: What less-popular systems programming language are you using? (227 points | 305 comments)
30. The Golden Age of Japanese Pencils (2022) (341 points | 97 comments)
